content: Somali Islamist militant group al-Shabab has staged several attacks in Kenya, prompting the border to be closed.

content: Experts weigh in on challenges from climate change and water access to upstream-downstream conflict and industry abuse.

originalTitle: Milano Cortina acting as ‘propaganda for Russia’, says banned Heraskevych
title: Fair Play at the Winter Olympics: Vlad's Big Ask!
content:
Hello, Friends! What Are We Talking About?

Hello, hello, my wonderful friends all across Africa! Your special kid-friendly news reporter is here to share some exciting and important news with you today. Are you ready for a story about sports, bravery, and doing what's right? I hope so! Today, we are going to talk about a very brave athlete. An athlete is a person who plays sports and tries very hard to win. This special athlete comes from a country called Ukraine, which is far away from us, but we can still learn from him. His name is Vladyslav Heraskevych. Wow, that's a long name! Let's just call him Vlad for short, okay? Vlad plays a super cool and super-fast sport called skeleton. It sounds a bit spooky, but it's really exciting! We are also going to talk about something called the Winter Olympics. Have you ever heard of the Olympics? It's a huge party where athletes from all over the world come together to play different games. The Winter Olympics are special because all the games are played on snow and ice! Think about skiing, snowboarding, and even sledding. It's a big, chilly, fun event!

Who is Vladyslav and What is Skeleton?

So, let's learn a bit more about our hero, Vlad. Vlad is a very strong and determined young man. He trains very hard every day to be the best skeleton racer he can be. He loves his sport and he loves his country, Ukraine. Now, what exactly is skeleton? Imagine lying down head-first on a tiny, super-fast sled. You zoom down an icy track, going faster than a car on the road! You wear a special helmet and suit to keep you safe. It takes a lot of courage and skill to do this! Did you know? Skeleton racers can go super-duper fast, sometimes over 120 kilometres per hour! That's faster than many cars drive! It's like flying on the ice. Only the bravest athletes choose this thrilling sport. Sports are amazing, aren't they? They teach us to play fair, to work hard, and to cheer for our friends. They also bring people from different countries together to share their talents. That's why big events like the Olympics are so special.

The Big Sports Party: Milano Cortina

Now, let's talk about where this big sports party is going to be. There is a very special place in a country called Italy. Italy is famous for its delicious food, beautiful history, and stunning mountains. This place is called Milano Cortina. Milano Cortina is getting ready to host the Winter Olympics in a few years, in 2026! It's going to be a grand celebration of winter sports. Think of all the snow and ice that will be there! Athletes from all over the world dream of going to Milano Cortina. Did you know? Italy is a country in Europe, shaped a bit like a boot! It has very tall mountains called the Alps, which are perfect for winter sports. Hosting the Olympics is a huge honour for any country. It means they get to welcome the world! When a country hosts the Olympics, it gets to show off its beautiful land and friendly people. It's a chance to share joy and sportsmanship with everyone. It's a time for countries to come together in a spirit of friendship and healthy competition.

Why is Vladyslav Upset?

So, if the Olympics are about friendship and fun, why is Vlad upset? Well, this is the important part of our story. Vlad believes that inviting some athletes from Russia to the upcoming Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina might not be a fair thing to do right now. He feels that letting Russia take part in such a big, happy world event might make Russia look good, like a big advertisement. He calls this 'propaganda.' It's like saying, 'Look, everything is fine here!' even when some things are not fine in the world. Did you know? 'Propaganda' is a big word, but it just means showing things in a way that makes one country or idea look very good, sometimes to influence how people think. Vlad thinks this would not be right because of sad things happening in his home country, Ukraine. Vlad wants the world to remember that things are not peaceful for everyone. He believes that sports should always be fair and honest. He doesn't want the big sports party to accidentally send the wrong message. He is very brave to speak up about this. He wants the world to pay attention to fairness for his country.

What is a "CAS Hearing"?

Because Vlad feels so strongly about this, he is going to a very special meeting. This meeting is called a 'CAS hearing.' CAS stands for the Court of Arbitration for Sport. It sounds very important, doesn't it? Think of it like a special court, but just for sports! When athletes or sports groups have a big problem or disagree about rules, they go to the CAS. The people at CAS listen to everyone and try to make fair decisions. Did you know? The CAS is like a referee for big sports problems! It makes sure that all the rules are followed and that everyone gets a chance to be heard. It's super important for keeping sports fair and honest worldwide. Vlad is going to this meeting to tell his story. He will explain why he thinks it's not fair to let certain athletes from Russia join the Olympics right now. He hopes that the people at the CAS will listen to him and make a decision that feels right and fair for everyone, especially for his country, Ukraine. He is using his voice to make a difference.

Why is This Important for All of Us?

So, why does this matter to us, my friends, all the way here in Africa? This story teaches us a very important lesson about fairness and speaking up. Even if we are not athletes, we can all learn from Vlad. It reminds us that sports are more than just games. They are about respect, peace, and playing by the rules. When someone feels something is unfair, it's brave to talk about it and try to make things better. Did you know? Speaking up for what you believe is right is a very powerful thing to do! It can help change things for the better, not just in sports, but in our schools, our homes, and our communities too. Vlad is showing us that every voice matters. He is standing up for fairness for his country and for the spirit of true sportsmanship. Let's remember to always play fair, be kind to everyone, and if something doesn't feel right, to talk about it. That's all for today, my wonderful friends! Keep being kind and keep learning. Your African news reporter sends you a big high-five! See you next time for more exciting news!
summary: A brave athlete named Vlad from Ukraine is asking a special sports court to make sure the upcoming Winter Olympics are fair for everyone, especially because of sad things happening in his country.
whyMatters: This is important because it teaches us about being brave, speaking up for fairness, and making sure big sports events always promote peace and respect for all countries.
